contentData.text: Here’s everything we run for children and young people. For more information about anything here, get in touch with Cat (07535 668093). We take the care of our children and young people very seriously – see here for more about safeguarding.

Mini Phillies - Stay & Play Group

We have toys and snacks for the little ones, and sofas, hot drinks, and adult company for you.

9.30-11.00am every Wednesday in term time.

£1 per family - free for your first time.

For more information, email alice@stphilemons.co.uk, check out our Facebook page, or just drop in!

 

 

Sunday Crèche (11am)

On Sundays at 11am, we'll take your 0-4s off your hands (if you want us to) for the duration of the service.

We're a team of trained, DBS-vetted adults who love children and don't mind a bit of noise.

Sundays

Age 4 to School Year 6 | During the 11am service | Church | Every week

 

After some time all together, we go to our own groups. We listen to a story from the Bible so we can get to know Jesus, play games including football and make crafts.

 

We aim to make Sunday the best day of the week for the children so we have a lot of fun. And someone always wins the trophy at the end!

 

Mondays

School Year 5-6 | 5:30-6:30pm | Church | Term time

 

We meet at church, chat about the Bible and play some games. It’s a chance to think deeply about what God says, ask our questions and have some fun. Sometimes we do other things too, like a picnic in the park.

 

Get in touch with Gabriel for more details (07944 340589).

Sundays

School Year 7-13 | Term time

 

Every other week, we have breakfast together before church at 11am, including waffles, pancakes or bacon. We look at the bit of the Bible that we’re going to look at during church and start to understand it together. When we don’t have breakfast, we have our own group during the 11am service, again looking at the Bible together.

Breakfast @ 9:30am at 12 Mountview Close - see the church calendar for dates.

 

 

 

Mondays

School Year 7-13 | 6:30-7:45pm | Church | Term time

 

 

We meet at church, chat about the Bible and play some games. It’s a chance to think deeply about what God says, ask our questions and have some fun. Sometimes we do other things too, like a picnic in the park.

 

Get in touch with Cat for more details about things for youth (07535 668093).
